item.title: Using OpenSSH Server as a Tunnel on Windows
item.description: Confession: Windows 10 is a great operating system, and it’s my primary both at work and at home, but I don’t always use Windows. I’ve made a conscious decision to use Linux as a host OS on occasion so that I can learn its ins and outs, which helps me solve problems for customers, makes me more productive in the cloud, helps me troubleshoot fiddly devices at home, etc. But sometimes, I have a problem - I need to be able to access computers on the corporate network, and the RDP Gateway server I’ve been using doesn’t seem to be supported anymore.
